glsa.title: dhcpcd: Denial of Service vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in dhcpcd may cause the dhcpcd daemon to crash.

background.p: dhcpcd is a standards compliant DHCP client daemon. It requests an IP address and other information from the DHCP server, automatically configures the network interface, and tries to renew the lease time.

description.p: infamous42md discovered that dhcpcd can be tricked to read past the end of the supplied DHCP buffer. As a result, this might lead to a crash of the daemon.

impact.p: With a malicious DHCP server an attacker could cause a Denial of Service by crashing the DHCP client.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
